hanzi-su-wiki:
商

Значения

Торговать

Мнемоника

Совмещение элементов речь 言, рот 口 и внутри 内. Скрытно, как караванные купцы, совещаться, заранее договариваться о ценах.
purpleculture_pinyin:
shāng
commerce; merchant; dealer; to consult; 2nd note in pentatonic scale; quotient (as in 智商 , intelligence quotient)
коммерция; торговец; дилер; консультироваться; 2-я нота в пентатонике; частное (например, коэффициент интеллекта)
rtega_mnemonic:
商商RS
X		trade, do business
  • merchant with his several 八 wares in baskets, pots 口
 売 貿 販; 営 業

商商RS𠿧𠹧𡅟𠾃𡄚𧶜 𡄚commerce, business, trade, make a deal, selling
  • modf. 𠹧 → 商: big man 大/儿 standing 立 at the market 冂 selling with a loud mouth 口

heisig_chinese_memo: The standing member at the top is a certain part of the body that all men have and it is approaching the hole between two legs (the hood) with extra marks to show they are fleshy - ie a womans legs. So this shows the oldest deal of all time - prostitution.  The original salesman.
heisig_constituent: make a deal, vase, stand up, alien, hood, human legs, mouth
heisig_story: See the peddlar standing atop his motorcycle helmet as if it were a soapbox, hawking his wares to passersby. The legs and mouth represent the tools of the trade of making a deal any way you can.
myStory:
stand (立) and be bright (冏) to be a trader

the wide (冂) mouth (口) with legs (儿) is bright

冏 – see 囧 (“patterned window; a clear and bright window; shining, brightness; etc.”).
Keyword_KANJIDIC: make a deal, selling, dealing in, merchant
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: заключить сделку, продажа, дело в, коммерсант
koohiiStory1: I use what I think is the real etymology for this kanji which is so shocking it sticks. The STANDING member at the top is a certain part of the body that all men have and it is approaching the HOLE between TWO LEGS (the HOOD) with extra marks to show they are FLESHY - ie a womans legs. So this shows the oldest DEAL of all time - prostitution.
koohiiStory2: Slick Willy standing on the motorcycle helmet he´s trying to sell you to demonstrate how rugged it is. His legs crash through the top of it and after a moment of awkward silence his mouth opens and says, "hey, we can still make a deal.".

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A standing mustache with legs is able to sell merchandise. Most mustaches can’t stand because they don’t have legs. This mustache, however, does. It also has a keen business sense, which is why it’s selling merchandise.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this mustache entrepreneur, standing at his merchandise stand, selling his wares. He looks quite dignified, legs and all.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The mustache is selling his merchandise so well that even the Shougun (しょう) notices. He leans down really close to the standing mustache man's merchandise and stays very still. Then he snaps his fingers and his servants come rushing out to buy it all!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Now all of the merchandise belongs to the Shougun. The mustache has nothing left to sell, but at least he's rich!
Ru_Meaning: make a deal, selling, dealing in, merchant
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 儿 (ножки), 并, 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 口 (рот), 立 (стоять)
Ru_trainchinese:
shāng: (графема) бизнес, коммерция; торговец, бизнесмен; совещаться, обсуждать
shāng: (графема) Династия Шан; (муз.) Шан (второй тон китайского пятиступенного лада)
shāng: (сущ/глаг) (матем.) частное; являться частным
Kanshudo_mnemonic: stand (立) and be bright (冏) to be a trader
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The standing member at the top is a certain part of the body that all men have and it is approaching the hole between two legs (the hood) with extra marks to show they are fleshy - ie a womans legs. So this shows the oldest deal of all time - prostitution.  The original salesman.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The ancient Chinese kings used large animals for ceremonial sacrifices. The cow was one of the important animal sacrifices. (物, wu, thing) To the left of the character, there is a character which symbolizes the head of the cow (牛, niu, cattle), to the right, there is a character which symbolizes the knife (刀, dao, knife), and there are blood splattered (). This character depicts cutting a cow with a knife. Bronze Knife (13th-11th century BC) During the Shang (商) Dynasty (1600–1046 BC), the aristocrats sacrificed many animals for ceremonies. According to the records, the emperor’s court also had many luxurious and grand ceremonies. At one occasion, hundreds of cows were sacrificed. Various sacrifices were offered other than cows at these ceremonies as well. So, (物, wu) changed its meaning from “sacrifice” to “things.”
humanum_full_description_en:
" Business " the original meaning of the word is unknown, Zhu Fang Po that word from " propane " from " Sim ", " propylene " as the shape of the high-profile, " Sim " that is, " salary " shape of the province, the whole word will firewood into high platform Burn to worship the big Mars. Later borrowed to represent the " business " of merchants.

It is said that " Shang " is like a wine vessel, but this is not as credible as Zhu said, because in addition to the usual writing, the word "商" in the Jia Jin inscriptions is also added with two or four circles on both sides (like the stars Form), that is, the special word for " shang " in the stars that never meets with " ginseng " (that is, the main star of Scorpio, Antares, also known as the Great Mars, which means "in the Book of Songs. Binfeng. July" Flowing Fire in July"). Since " shang " has the meaning of sacrificing the stars, it seems that the training of " shang " as a wine vessel cannot explain this phenomenon. Later, the " business " was removed from the " business " as a merchant. "Shuowen": "Shang, from outside to know the inside. From 㕯, chapter and sound."

The oracle " Shang " is used as the name of the person, "He Ji" 7058: "Don't (call) the business to go against." It is also used as the place name, referring to the capital of Yin, "He Ji" 2731: "As for the business." "He Ji" 7784 : "Wang Yusheng entered Shang in July." Inscriptions often used words such as "Dayi Shang" and "Tianyi Shang", meaning Shang Guo, "He Ji" 36530: "Only (in) Dayi Shang." "Shang Shu. Zhou Shu: "Weichen attached to Dayi Zhou."

Bronze inscriptions were used as the name of the country, and it became a soup to destroy the summer, and the name was built as a business. It is profitable: "Liu (wu) seeks business." There is also the term "Dayi Shang", referring to the country of business, such as Zun: "隹( Only) King Suo (Wu) can both conquer Dayi merchants." It is also used as a person's name, Shang Zun: "Shang Zun: "Shang Zun (Zhang Zhuang) Wen Biri Ding Bao Zun Yi." Also used as a musical name, it is one of the five tones, Zeng Hou Yizhong: " "Mu Yinzhishang." In addition, the word is also used for " reward ", referring to reward, Zi Zun: "Wang Shang (reward) son Huang Liyi, Bei Baipeng." See " Reward ".

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are also used as the name of the country. "Lian Nian" Jane 1: "In the past Zhou Wu Wang supervised the Shang Wang's disrespect to God", which means that Zhou Wu Wang observed that Shang Wang did not respect God in the past. It is also used as the name of the rhythm, "Shangbo Zhushu IV. "Caifeng Repertoire" Jane 2: "Yin (Yan) Quotient" means one octave lower than the positive sound quotient.

Han silk book " Shang " used as " ramp, " referring to rampant, "Mawangdui. Line 155 of the Old Unused Book before the Second Volume of Lao Zi: "Shang (ramp) Que (獗) and 栝 (live), the ancestors (lie)." "Suo Yuan. "Tan Cong": "Living rampantly, the ancestors Yu Lie." The full sentence refers to the frustration and being able to live, that is the deeds left by the ancestors.
humanum_short_description_en: The word " Shang " will burn firewood on a high platform to worship the Mars (Zhu Fangpu). Then borrow the " business " of the merchant.
humanum_full_description:
「商」字本義不詳，朱芳圃以為字從「丙」從「辛」，「丙」象高台之形，「辛」即「薪」之省形，全字會把柴薪放到高台上燃燒，以祭祀大火星。後借用來表示商賈之「商」。

　　一說「商」象酒器，唯此說似不及朱說可信，因為甲金文的「商」字，除一般的寫法外，也有於兩旁加從兩個或四個圓圈(象星星之形)，即表示星宿中與「參」永不相見的「商」的專字(即天蝎座的主星心宿二，又名大火星，也即《詩經．豳風．七月》中指的「七月流火」)。由於「商」有祭星之意味，因此把「商」訓為酒器似乎不能解釋這現象。後來「商」除借作商賈的「商」。《說文》：「商，从外知内也。从㕯，章省聲。」

　　甲骨文「商」用作人名，《合集》7058：「勿乎(呼)商取逆。」又用作地名，指殷之王都，《合集》2731正：「至于商。」《合集》7784：「王于生七月入于商。」卜辭常見「大邑商」、「天邑商」等詞，意指商國，《合集》36530：「才(在)大邑商。」《尚書．周書》：「惟臣附于大邑周。」

　　金文用作國邑名，成湯滅夏，建號為商，利𣪕：「珷(武)征商。」又有「大邑商」一詞，指商國，如尊：「隹(唯)珷(武)王既克大邑商。」又用作人名，商尊：「商用乍(作)文辟日丁寶尊彝。」又用作樂律名，為五音之一，曾侯乙鍾：「穆音之商。」另，字又用作「賞」，指賞賜，子尊：「王商(賞)子黃鬲一、貝百朋。」參見「賞」。

　　戰國竹簡亦用作國邑名，《清華簡二．繫年》簡1：「昔周武王監觀商王之不恭上帝」，意謂以往周武王觀察到商王不恭敬上帝。又用作樂律名，《上博竹書四．采風曲目》簡2：「訐(衍)商」，指比正音商低一個八度。

　　漢帛書「商」用作「猖」，指猖獗，《馬王堆．老子乙本卷前古佚書》第155行：「商(猖)闕(獗)而栝(活)，先人之連(烈)。」《說苑．談叢》：「猖蹷而活，先人餘烈。」全句指受挫而能活着，那是先人留下的功業。
humanum_short_description: 「商」字會把柴薪放到高台上燃燒，以祭祀大火星(朱芳圃)。後借表商賈之「商」。

①两个以上的人在一起计划、讨论：商量。商讨。商议。商定。商榷。商酌(商量斟酌)。相商。磋商。洽商。协商。
②买卖，生意：商业。商店。商界。商品。商标。
③古指行商(坐商为“贾”，后泛指做买卖的人，亦用以指从事私营工商业的人)：商人。商贩。商贾(商人)。商旅。
④数学上指除法运算中的得数：商数。
⑤中国朝代名：商代。
⑥中国古代五音之一，相当于简谱“2”。
⑦星名，二十八宿之一，即“心宿”。
⑧姓氏。

「 商 」字本義不詳，朱芳圃以為字從「 丙 」從「 辛 」，「 丙 」象高台之形，「 辛 」即「 薪 」之省形，全字會把柴薪放到高台上燃燒，以祭祀大火星。後借用來表示商賈之「 商 」。 一說「 商 」象酒器，唯此說似不及朱說可信，因為甲金文的「 商 」字，除一般的寫法外，也有於兩旁加從兩個或四個圓圈(象星星之形)，即表示星宿中與「 參 」永不相見的「 商 」的專字(即天蝎座的主星心宿二，又名大火星，也即《詩經．豳風．七月》中指的「七月流火」)。由於「 商 」有祭星之意味，因此把「 商 」訓為酒器似乎不能解釋這現象。後來「 商 」除借作商賈的「 商 」。《說文》：「商，从外知内也。从㕯，章省聲。」 甲骨文「 商 」用作人名，《合集》7058：「勿乎(呼)商取逆。」又用作地名，指殷之王都，《合集》2731正：「至于商。」《合集》7784：「王于生七月入于商。」卜辭常見「大邑商」、「天邑商」等詞，意指商國，《合集》36530：「才(在)大邑商。」《尚書．周書》：「惟臣附于大邑周。」 金文用作國邑名，成湯滅夏，建號為商，利𣪕：「珷(武)征商。」又有「大邑商」一詞，指商國，如尊：「隹(唯)珷(武)王既克大邑商。」又用作人名，商尊：「商用乍(作)文辟日丁寶尊彝。」又用作樂律名，為五音之一，曾侯乙鍾：「穆音之商。」另，字又用作「 賞 」，指賞賜，子尊：「王商(賞)子黃鬲一、貝百朋。」參見「 賞 」。 戰國竹簡亦用作國邑名，《清華簡二．繫年》簡1：「昔周武王監觀商王之不恭上帝」，意謂以往周武王觀察到商王不恭敬上帝。又用作樂律名，《上博竹書四．采風曲目》簡2：「訐(衍)商」，指比正音商低一個八度。 漢帛書「 商 」用作「 猖 」，指猖獗，《馬王堆．老子乙本卷前古佚書》第155行：「商(猖)闕(獗)而栝(活)，先人之連(烈)。」《說苑．談叢》：「猖蹷而活，先人餘烈。」全句指受挫而能活着，那是先人留下的功業。
" Business" the original meaning of the word is unknown, Zhu Fang Po that word from " propane" from " Sim", " propylene" as the shape of the high-profile, " Sim" that is, " salary" shape of the province, the whole word will firewood into high platform Burn to worship the big Mars. Later borrowed to represent the " business" of merchants. It is said that " Shang" is like a wine vessel, but this is not as credible as Zhu said, because in addition to the usual writing, the word " 商" in the Jia Jin inscriptions is also added with two or four circles on both sides (like the stars Form), that is, the special word for " shang" in the stars that never meets with " ginseng" (that is, the main star of Scorpio, Antares, also known as the Great Mars, which means "in the Book of Songs. Binfeng. July" Flowing Fire in July"). Since " shang" has the meaning of sacrificing the stars, it seems that the training of " shang" as a wine vessel cannot explain this phenomenon. Later, the " business" was removed from the " business" as a merchant. "Shuowen": "Shang, from outside to know the inside. From 㕯, chapter and sound." The oracle " Shang" is used as the name of the person, "He Ji" 7058: "Don't (call) the business to go against." It is also used as the place name, referring to the capital of Yin, "He Ji" 2731: "As for the business." "He Ji" 7784 : "Wang Yusheng entered Shang in July." Inscriptions often used words such as "Dayi Shang" and "Tianyi Shang", meaning Shang Guo, "He Ji" 36530: "Only (in) Dayi Shang." "Shang Shu. Zhou Shu: "Weichen attached to Dayi Zhou." Bronze inscriptions were used as the name of the country, and it became a soup to destroy the summer, and the name was built as a business. It is profitable: "Liu (wu) seeks business." There is also the term "Dayi Shang", referring to the country of business, such as Zun: "隹( Only) King Suo (Wu) can both conquer Dayi merchants." It is also used as a person's name, Shang Zun: "Shang Zun: "Shang Zun (Zhang Zhuang) Wen Biri Ding Bao Zun Yi." Also used as a musical name, it is one of the five tones, Zeng Hou Yizhong: " "Mu Yinzhishang." In addition, the word is also used for " reward", referring to reward, Zi Zun: "Wang Shang (reward) son Huang Liyi, Bei Baipeng." See " Reward". The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are also used as the name of the country. "Lian Nian" Jane 1: "In the past Zhou Wu Wang supervised the Shang Wang's disrespect to God", which means that Zhou Wu Wang observed that Shang Wang did not respect God in the past. It is also used as the name of the rhythm, "Shangbo Zhushu IV. "Caifeng Repertoire" Jane 2: "Yin (Yan) Quotient" means one octave lower than the positive sound quotient. Han silk book " Shang" used as " ramp," referring to rampant, "Mawangdui. Line 155 of the Old Unused Book before the Second Volume of Lao Zi: "Shang (ramp) Que (獗) and 栝 (live), the ancestors (lie)." "Suo Yuan. "Tan Cong": "Living rampantly, the ancestors Yu Lie." The full sentence refers to the frustration and being able to live, that is the deeds left by the ancestors.

商字的基本解释

商
shāng
两个以上的人在一起计划、讨论：商量。商讨。商议。商定。商榷。商酌（商量斟酌）。相商。磋商。洽商。协商。
买卖，生意：商业。商店。商界。商品。商标。
古指行商（坐商为“贾”，后泛指做买卖的人，亦用以指从事私营工商业的人）：商人。商贩。商贾（g?）（商人）。商旅。
数学上指除法运算中的得数：商数。
中国朝代名：商代。
中国古代五音之一，相当于简谱“2”。
星名，二十八宿之一，即“心宿”。
姓。
Shangquotient

商字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shāng］
［《廣韻》式羊切，平陽，書。］
亦作“謪1”。
(1)计量；计算。
(2)商讨；商量。
(3)经商，贩卖货物。
(4)商人，贩卖货物的人。
(5)五音（宫、商、角、徵、羽）之一。
(6)古人把五音与四季相配，商音配秋，因以商指秋季。
(7)古漏壶中箭上所刻的度数。
(8)星名。参见“商星”。
(9)朝代名。公元前十六世纪商汤灭夏所建，都亳。中经几次迁都，盤庚时迁殷（今河南安阳县小屯），因亦称殷。传至纣，为周武王所灭。共传十七代，三十一王。约当公元前十六世纪至前十一世纪。
(10)春秋诸侯国宋的别称。周灭商后，封商贵族微子的后代于宋，故宋又称商。
(11)犹鸧，以金银镶饰。
(12)通“章”，篇章。
(13)数学名词。一数除以不为零的数的结果称为“商”。
(14)姓。春秋鲁有商瞿。见《史记·仲尼弟子列传》。

商字的起名意思

：指买卖，做生意，也指做生意的人。还有交换意见，讨论等意思。

Basic explanation of words
Quotient
shāng
Two or more people plan and discuss together: discuss. discuss. Negotiate. Agreed. Discuss. Discuss (discuss and consider). talk over. Consultation. Negotiate. Negotiation.
Sale, business: business. store. Business. commodity. trademark.
In ancient times, it refers to merchants ("Jia" for businessmen, later generally refers to people who do business, and also refers to people engaged in private industry and commerce): merchants. Vendors. Merchant (g?) (merchant). Business travel.
Mathematically refers to the number obtained in the division operation: the quotient.
Chinese dynasty name: Shang Dynasty.
One of the five syllables in ancient China, equivalent to the numbered musical notation "2".
Star name, one of the twenty-eight lodges, that is, "hearts".
name.

Quotient
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shāng］
["Guangyun" style sheep cut, Pingyang, book. ]
Also known as "謪1".
(1) Measurement; calculation.
(2) Discuss; discuss.
(3) Doing business and selling goods.
(4) Merchants, people who sell goods.
(5) One of the five sounds (gong, Shang, Jiao, Zheng, Yu).
(6) The ancients matched the five tones with the four seasons, and the Shangyin with autumn, because Shang refers to autumn.
(7) The degree engraved on the arrow in the ancient clepsydra.
(8) Star name. See "Shang Xing".
(9) Dynasty names. In the 16th century BC, it was built by Shang Tang and Xixia, and the capital was Bo. Zhongjing moved its capital several times, and during Pan Geng moved to Yin (now Xiaotun, Anyang County, Henan), because it is also known as Yin. It spread to Zhou and was destroyed by King Wu of Zhou. A total of seventeen generations, thirty-one kings. From the sixteenth century BC to the eleventh century BC.
(10) Another name for the Song Dynasty of the Spring and Autumn Princes. After the Zhou Dynasty destroyed the Shang, the descendants of the nobles of the Shang Dynasty were in the Song Dynasty, so the Song Dynasty was also called Shang.
(11) Juhu, decorated with gold and silver.
(12) Through "chapter", chapter.
(13) Mathematical terms. The result of dividing a number by a number that is not zero is called the "quotient".
(14) Last name. There are Shang Qu in the Spring and Autumn Period. See "Historical Records · Biography of Zhongni's Disciples".

Source glyph
Quotient
Name meaning
: Refers to buying and selling, doing business, and also referring to people doing business. There are also meanings such as exchanging opinions and discussing.
商
shăng
[附) 赏
“商”是“賞”的本字,甲骨文
“商”字像一个盛酒的器皿放置在
底座上面,表示这是用米赏赐的
东西。甲骨下锋和金文铭文常以
“商”为“赏”。
天秀高爾 商有商
Частное
шэнг
(Прилагается) награда
«Шан» - оригинальное слово для «награды», а слово «nds» в надписях на костях оракула помещено на основание, как сосуд для вина, что указывает на то, что это что-то вознагражденное рисом.
В надписях на костях оракула и надписях часто используется «шанг» как «награда».
У Тяньсю Гауэра есть бизнес
shāng
I гл.
обсуждать, взвешивать; совещаться, консультироваться
相商 совместно обсуждать; советоваться
面商 лично обсуждать, договариваться
II сущ.
1) торговля, коммерция; торговый, коммерческий
经了几年商 несколько лет занимался торговлей
商行为 коммерческие акции; торговые акты (предпринимательство)
2) торговец, купец, коммерсант; купечество (как социальная группа)
布商 торговец холстом (мануфактурой)
富商 богатый купец
3) * деления на стрелке клепсидры
日入三商为昏 когда день переходит в третье деление клепсидры ― становятся сумерки
4) мат. частное
五除二十, 所得的商为四 при делении 20 на 5 частное равно 4
5) кит. муз. шан (вторая ступени китайского пятиступенного лада; соответствует 大簇 в китайской или ми, ε, в европейской номенклатуре); перен. (по ассоциации) осень; запад; печаль; осенний; западный; печальный
商声 ступень шан (вторая ступень пентатоники); голос осени, печальные звуки
商气 дыхание осени (запада)
商歌 грустная песня, элегия
6) астр. созвездие Синь («Сердце»); 5-е из 28 кит. зодиакальных созвездий; 5-е из 7 созвездий восточной области неба, состоит из 3 звёзд: σ, α (Антарес), ζ зодиакального созвездия Скорпион
7) ист. шан, шаны (племя, обитавшее в древнем Китае на территории нынешней пров. Хэнань)
III собств.
1) ист. Шан (династия, 1766 - 1122 г. до н. э.)
商朝 династия Шан
商纣 Чжоу из династии Шан (последний государь-тиран династии Шан)
2) * ист. Шан (государство на территории нынешней пров. Шэньси)
3) геогр. (сокр. вм. 商县) Шансянь (город в пров. Шэньси)
4) Шан (фамилия)
Radicals: 立, 冋, 儿  (stand, mustache, legs)
Meaning Mnemonic
A standing mustache with legs is able to sell merchandise. Most mustaches can’t stand because they don’t have legs. This mustache, however, does. It also has a keen business sense, which is why it’s selling merchandise.
Imagine this mustache entrepreneur, standing at his merchandise stand, selling his wares. He looks quite dignified, legs and all.
Reading Mnemonic
The mustache is selling his merchandise so well that even the Shougun (しょう) notices. He leans down really close to the standing mustache man's merchandise and stays very still. Then he snaps his fingers and his servants come rushing out to buy it all!
Now all of the merchandise belongs to the Shougun. The mustache has nothing left to sell, but at least he's rich!
